summary: The purpose of this article is to report the finding that the bacterial strain Pseudomonas aeruginosa AR01 may be a promising candidate for medical biotechnology because its genome encodes many therapeutic enzymes.

tools_software.tool: NCBI (National Center for Biotechnology Information) database

use_cases.case: The data under accession number NC_002516, which represents the genome Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1, was used to design primers for colony PCR. The PCR analysis identified sequences encoding specific cancer-adjacent therapeutic enzymes in the bacterium Pseudomonas aeruginosa AR01. The genome of P. aeruginosa PAO1 was chosen for this purpose because the authors found via a NCBI database search that this organism was both closely related to the AR01 strain and contained a high frequency of gene clusters encoding therapeutic enzymes of interest.
